Proposed Anti-Terrorism Law not against activists, says author tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740843 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740843/proposed-anti-terrorism-law-not-against-activists-says-author/story/ PBA party-list Representative Jericho Nograles on Tuesday denied that the proposed Anti-Terrorism Law is against activists, saying that it only targets terrorists and violent extremists. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 17:27:14 +0800
DOLE mulls asking for additional funds for OFW cash aid program tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740846 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740846/dole-mulls-asking-for-additional-funds-for-ofw-cash-aid-program/story/ The Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) on Tuesday said there is a possibility that it will ask for another round of fund augmentation for its cash assistance program for overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) displaced by the COVID-19 pandemic amid high number of applicants. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 17:16:47 +0800
Alkalde sa CamSur, lumalagare bilang duktor para tumulong sa laban vs COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740845 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/740845/alkalde-sa-camsur-lumalagare-bilang-duktor-para-tumulong-sa-laban-vs-covid-19/story/ Bukod sa pagiging alkalde ng San Jose, Camarines Sur, nagsisilbi rin bilang duktor si Marco Chavez, dahil sa kakulangan nila ng rural health workers para harapin ang laban sa COVID-19. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 17:14:51 +0800

Tue, 02 Jun 2020 17:10:13 +0800
DOH: Fresh, late distinction needed due to careful validation process tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740837 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740837/doh-fresh-late-distinction-needed-due-to-careful-validation-process/story/ The Department of Health said that its classification of COVID-19 cases as "fresh" or "late" when reporting the daily numbers is necessary due to the apparently painstaking nature of the validation process. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 17:06:01 +0800
Lawyer challenges Bayanihan law before Supreme Court tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740841 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740841/lawyer-challenges-bayanihan-law-before-supreme-court/story/ A lawyer has asked the Supreme Court (SC) to annul the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act in the first known case challenging the Duterte administration's response to the COVID-19 crisis. Jaime Ibañez, the former law dean of the Laguna State Polytechnic University, also asked the SC to annul two presidential proclamations and three other issuances in connection with the health emergency. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 17:03:53 +0800
Cops nab suspect in Mandaluyong fire tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740840 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/740840/cops-nab-suspect-in-mandaluyong-fire/story/ Police have arrested the suspect in the fire incident which took place in Barangay Addition Hills, Mandaluyong City that affected at least 1,500 families Monday. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 16:57:26 +0800
Mga 'unrecognized Pinoy nurse' na 'di nagdalawang-isip na tulungan ang Spain sa laban vs COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740826 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/740826/mga-unrecognized-pinoy-nurse-na-di-nagdalawang-isip-na-tulungan-ang-spain-sa-laban-vs-covid-19/story/ Mga nurse silang umalis ng Pilipinas pero karaniwang trabaho tulad ng pagiging domestic helper, parlorista, waiter, o babysitter, ang kanilang binagsakan sa Espanya. Pero nang sumiklab ang "digmaan" sa COVID-19 at kinailangan ng bansa ang dagdag na mga "sundalong" nakaputi, hindi nag-alinlangang tumulong ang ating mga kababayan. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 16:55:59 +0800
Philippines reports 359 more COVID-19 cases, total nears 19,000 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740819 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740819/philippines-reports-359-more-covid-19-cases-total-nears-19-000/story/ The Philippines on Tuesday recorded 359 more cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19)--176 “fresh” or newly validated and 183 reported late, bringing the total to 18,997. Tue, 02 Jun 2020 16:45:54 +0800
Drilon to DOH: Forego P11.7B proposed fund for contact tracing, spend prudently tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740839 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740839/drilon-to-doh-forego-p11-7b-proposed-fund-for-contact-tracing-spend-prudently/story/ Senate Minority Leader Franklin Drilon on Tuesday renewed his call for the Department of Health (DOH) to be resourceful in its contact tracing efforts and do away with the projected P11.7 billion government spending for such an endeavor. DOLE sends home 25,000 OFWs stranded in quarantine facilities tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740834 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740834/dole-sends-home-25-000-ofws-stranded-in-quarantine-facilities/story/ On the heels of the directive of President Rodrigo Duterte to send home all repatriated overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) stranded in quarantine facilities, the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) said Tuesday it has sent over 25,000 migrant workers to their respective provinces.
